dialogue.speaker: Barista
dialogue.text: Hi! Welcome to Starbucks. What can I get for you today?
dialogue.translation: 안녕하세요! 스타벅스에 오신 것을 환영합니다. 오늘 무엇을 드릴까요?
dialogue.notes: 'What can I get for you?' = 주문 받을 때 표준 표현

dialogue.speaker: Customer
dialogue.text: Hi! Can I get a tall latte, please?
dialogue.translation: 안녕하세요! 톨 사이즈 라떼 하나 주세요.
dialogue.notes: 'Can I get...' = 가장 자연스러운 주문 표현

dialogue.speaker: Barista
dialogue.text: Sure! Hot or iced?
dialogue.translation: 네! 뜨거운 거요, 차가운 거요?

dialogue.speaker: Customer
dialogue.text: Hot, please. And can I get that for here?
dialogue.translation: 뜨거운 걸로 주세요. 그리고 매장에서 먹을게요.
dialogue.notes: 'for here' = 매장 내 식사, 'to go' = 포장

dialogue.speaker: Barista
dialogue.text: Of course! That'll be five dollars.
dialogue.translation: 물론이죠! 5달러입니다.

questions.question: Does the customer want it hot or iced?

title: 길 묻기
situation: 길을 잃어서 지나가는 사람에게 묻는 상황

dialogue.speaker: Tourist
dialogue.text: Excuse me, could you help me?
dialogue.translation: 실례합니다, 도와주실 수 있나요?

dialogue.speaker: Local
dialogue.text: Sure! What do you need?
dialogue.translation: 물론이죠! 무엇이 필요하세요?

dialogue.speaker: Tourist
dialogue.text: I'm looking for the subway station. Is it near here?
dialogue.translation: 지하철역을 찾고 있는데요. 여기 근처에 있나요?

dialogue.speaker: Local
dialogue.text: Yes! Go straight for two blocks, then turn left.
dialogue.translation: 네! 두 블록 직진하시고, 왼쪽으로 도세요.

dialogue.speaker: Tourist
dialogue.text: Thank you so much!
dialogue.translation: 정말 감사합니다!

questions.question: What is the tourist looking for?
How should the tourist go?
questions.explanation: 'Go straight for two blocks, then turn left'라고 안내했습니다.

dialogue.speaker: Restaurant
dialogue.text: Good evening, Mario's Italian Restaurant. How may I help you?
dialogue.translation: 좋은 저녁입니다, 마리오 이탈리안 레스토랑입니다. 무엇을 도와드릴까요?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Hi! I'd like to make a reservation for tonight.
dialogue.translation: 안녕하세요! 오늘 저녁 예약하고 싶은데요.

dialogue.speaker: Restaurant
dialogue.text: Certainly! What time and for how many people?
dialogue.translation: 물론이죠! 몇 시에 몇 명이신가요?

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Seven PM for four people, please.
dialogue.translation: 저녁 7시에 4명이요.

dialogue.speaker: Restaurant
dialogue.text: Perfect! May I have your name?
dialogue.translation: 완벽합니다! 성함을 여쭤봐도 될까요?
dialogue.notes: 'May I have your name?' = 이름 물을 때

dialogue.speaker: Caller
dialogue.text: Yes, it's John Smith.
dialogue.translation: 네, John Smith입니다.

dialogue.speaker: Staff
dialogue.text: Hi! Can I help you find anything?
dialogue.translation: 안녕하세요! 뭘 찾으시는 거 도와드릴까요?

dialogue.speaker: Customer
dialogue.text: Yes, I'm looking for this shirt in a medium.
dialogue.translation: 네, 이 셔츠 미디엄 사이즈 찾고 있어요.

dialogue.speaker: Staff
dialogue.text: Let me check... Yes, we have it! Would you like to try it on?
dialogue.translation: 확인해볼게요... 네, 있습니다! 입어보시겠어요?

dialogue.speaker: Customer
dialogue.text: Yes, please. Where's the fitting room?
dialogue.translation: 네, 부탁드려요. 탈의실이 어디있나요?

dialogue.speaker: Staff
dialogue.text: It's right over there, next to the cashier.
dialogue.translation: 저기 있어요, 계산대 옆에요.

questions.question: What size does the customer want?

dialogue.speaker: Teacher
dialogue.text: Class, we have a new student today. Please introduce yourself.
dialogue.translation: 여러분, 오늘 새 학생이 왔어요. 자기소개 해주세요.

dialogue.speaker: Student
dialogue.text: Hi everyone! My name is Sarah. I'm from Canada.
dialogue.translation: 안녕하세요 여러분! 제 이름은 Sarah예요. 캐나다에서 왔어요.

dialogue.speaker: Teacher
dialogue.text: Welcome, Sarah! What do you like to do in your free time?
dialogue.translation: 환영합니다, Sarah! 여가 시간에 뭘 좋아하세요?

dialogue.speaker: Student
dialogue.text: I love reading books and playing soccer.
dialogue.translation: 책 읽는 걸 좋아하고 축구하는 것도 좋아해요.

dialogue.speaker: Teacher
dialogue.text: That's great! We have a soccer team here.
dialogue.translation: 좋네요! 우리 여기 축구팀이 있어요.

questions.question: What does Sarah like to do?
questions.explanation: 'reading books and playing soccer'를 좋아한다고 했습니다.

dialogue.speaker: News Anchor
dialogue.text: Good morning. Here are today's top stories.
dialogue.translation: 좋은 아침입니다. 오늘의 주요 뉴스입니다.

dialogue.speaker: News Anchor
dialogue.text: The government announced new environmental policies yesterday aimed at reducing carbon emissions by 30% over the next decade.
dialogue.translation: 정부가 어제 향후 10년간 탄소 배출을 30% 감축하기 위한 새로운 환경 정책을 발표했습니다.

dialogue.speaker: News Anchor
dialogue.text: In business news, technology stocks rose sharply following strong earnings reports from major companies.
dialogue.translation: 경제 뉴스에서는, 주요 기업들의 강력한 실적 발표 이후 기술주가 급등했습니다.

dialogue.speaker: News Anchor
dialogue.text: And in sports, the national team won their qualifying match 3-1, securing their spot in the championship.
dialogue.translation: 그리고 스포츠에서는, 국가대표팀이 예선전에서 3대1로 승리하며 챔피언십 진출권을 확보했습니다.

questions.question: What is the government's goal for carbon emissions?

dialogue.speaker: Manager
dialogue.text: Thanks everyone for joining. Let's start with project updates. Sarah, how's the marketing campaign going?
dialogue.translation: 참석해주셔서 감사합니다. 프로젝트 업데이트부터 시작하죠. Sarah, 마케팅 캠페인은 어떻게 되고 있나요?

dialogue.speaker: Employee
dialogue.text: It's progressing well. We've completed the initial phase and we're on track to launch next month.
dialogue.translation: 잘 진행되고 있습니다. 초기 단계를 완료했고 다음 달 출시 일정에 맞춰 가고 있습니다.

dialogue.speaker: Manager
dialogue.text: Excellent! Have you encountered any challenges so far?
dialogue.translation: 훌륭합니다! 지금까지 어떤 어려움은 없었나요?

dialogue.speaker: Employee
dialogue.text: We had some budget constraints, but we've managed to work around them by prioritizing key features.
dialogue.translation: 예산 제약이 있었지만, 핵심 기능에 우선순위를 두어 해결했습니다.

dialogue.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue.text: Thank you for coming in today. Could you tell me about your previous work experience?
dialogue.translation: 오늘 와주셔서 감사합니다. 이전 업무 경험에 대해 말씀해주시겠어요?

dialogue.speaker: Candidate
dialogue.text: Certainly. I worked as a junior developer at a tech startup for two years, where I focused primarily on front-end development.
dialogue.translation: 물론입니다. 기술 스타트업에서 2년간 주니어 개발자로 일했으며, 주로 프론트엔드 개발에 집중했습니다.

dialogue.speaker: Interviewer
dialogue.text: That's impressive. What made you interested in this position?
dialogue.translation: 인상적이네요. 이 포지션에 관심을 갖게 된 이유는 무엇인가요?

dialogue.speaker: Candidate
dialogue.text: I'm particularly drawn to your company's innovative approach to problem-solving and the opportunity to work on large-scale projects.
dialogue.translation: 귀사의 혁신적인 문제 해결 방식과 대규모 프로젝트에서 일할 수 있는 기회에 특히 매력을 느꼈습니다.

questions.question: How long did the candidate work at the startup?
What attracted the candidate to this job?

dialogue.speaker: Professor
dialogue.text: Today we'll discuss the impact of social media on modern communication. What are your thoughts on this topic?
dialogue.translation: 오늘은 소셜 미디어가 현대 커뮤니케이션에 미치는 영향에 대해 토론하겠습니다. 이 주제에 대한 생각이 어떠신가요?

dialogue.speaker: Student
dialogue.text: I believe social media has fundamentally changed how we interact. While it's made communication more accessible, it's also created challenges in maintaining meaningful connections.
dialogue.translation: 소셜 미디어가 우리의 상호작용 방식을 근본적으로 바꿨다고 생각합니다. 커뮤니케이션을 더 쉽게 만들었지만, 의미 있는 연결을 유지하는 데 어려움도 만들었습니다.

dialogue.speaker: Professor
dialogue.text: That's an interesting perspective. Can you elaborate on the challenges you mentioned?
dialogue.translation: 흥미로운 관점이네요. 말씀하신 어려움에 대해 좀 더 설명해주시겠어요?

dialogue.speaker: Student
dialogue.text: Well, people tend to have superficial interactions online rather than deep, face-to-face conversations. This can lead to feelings of isolation despite being constantly connected.
dialogue.translation: 사람들이 깊이 있는 대면 대화보다 온라인에서 피상적인 상호작용을 하는 경향이 있습니다. 이것이 끊임없이 연결되어 있음에도 고립감을 느끼게 할 수 있습니다.

questions.question: What is the discussion topic?
questions.explanation: 'impact of social media on modern communication'이 주제입니다.

questions.question: What problem does the student mention?

dialogue.speaker: Support
dialogue.text: Thank you for calling Tech Support. This is Mike speaking. How can I assist you today?
dialogue.translation: 기술 지원팀에 전화주셔서 감사합니다. Mike입니다. 오늘 무엇을 도와드릴까요?

dialogue.speaker: Customer
dialogue.text: Hi Mike. I'm having trouble with my laptop. It won't turn on no matter what I do.
dialogue.translation: 안녕하세요 Mike. 노트북에 문제가 있어요. 뭘 해도 켜지지 않아요.

dialogue.speaker: Support
dialogue.text: I understand how frustrating that must be. Let's try some troubleshooting steps. Have you checked if the battery is properly connected?
dialogue.translation: 얼마나 답답하실지 이해합니다. 문제 해결 단계를 시도해봅시다. 배터리가 제대로 연결되어 있는지 확인하셨나요?

dialogue.speaker: Customer
dialogue.text: Yes, I've checked that. The battery seems fine, but the power button doesn't respond at all.
dialogue.translation: 네, 확인했어요. 배터리는 괜찮아 보이는데, 전원 버튼이 전혀 반응하지 않아요.

dialogue.speaker: Support
dialogue.text: Alright. In that case, I recommend bringing it to our service center. I can schedule an appointment for you right away.
dialogue.translation: 알겠습니다. 그렇다면 서비스 센터로 가져오시는 것을 추천합니다. 바로 예약해드릴 수 있습니다.

questions.question: What is the problem with the laptop?
questions.explanation: 노트북이 켜지지 않는다('won't turn on')고 말했습니다.

questions.question: What does the support agent recommend?
questions.explanation: 'bringing it to our service center'를 추천했습니다.
